Text.Text: What?  Did Ulbrec send you to seize more lumber?  Or take a few score weapons perhaps?  Take it all!  I'm a dragon's flight past caring what happens to this damned town!
Goblins at the docks?  Have they taken the Gallaway warehouse?
If they burn down those supplies, then I'm ruined!  What are you even standing here for if they're attacking the docks - you're one of the mercenary companies, aren't you?

Consider the town warned - I'll let others know, but if you're part of the Guard, you should be down at the docks!  If those goblins do any damage to the port, they'll cut Targos off from Dualdon, and then we'll really be in trouble.

Shake the sleep out of your eyes!  You *are* the reinforcements.  If you're part of the Guard, you should be down at the docks!  If those goblins do any damage to the port, they'll cut Targos off from Dualdon, and then we'll be as good as dead.
You can find him at the Targos Town Hall on the east side of town, by the southern cliffs - now hurry!
What are you doing here?  Have the goblins taken the docks?
Well, that's a load off my shoulders, then.  I feared the warehouse would have been destroyed in the attack.
You're back, I see.  Lots of folks around town are talking about your bravery at the docks.  Anything I could help you with?
It's the remains of the Gallaway Trading Post of Targos - though I fear little will be left after the soldiers of Targos are through plundering it for the war effort.
Truly?  Then, please, look around - if anything strikes your eye, let me know, and we'll come to an arrangement.
Good, that means we're doing our job.  The Gallaway Trading Coster has grown over the years - my grandfather, Ilmus, used to run caravans throughout the Ten-Towns, including Lonelywood and Easthaven.

His age... *and* his love of Cormyrian brandy... has finally caught up with him, so he's left the traveling and the day-to-day work for the rest of the family.  But enough of that - what can I help you with?

Wh-?  Oh... nay, nay, nay - your little band of cutthroats that call themselves the Guard won't be confiscating another scrap of iron, wood, or cloth from me, they won't!  They've already nearly cleaned me out of all except the rats!
Lord of Targos?  Ha!  You don't even KNOW Ulbrec, and even if you did, that doesn't give you the right to play the buccaneer in my store!  How *dare* you!
With what, another scrap of debt paper?  A promise from Crale?  A 'thank you' from Ulbrec?  Oh, nay, words and papers will go no further with me, they won't.
You best watch your tongue when speaking words like that, mercenary.  If you touch anything in here without my leave, *anything,* and I'll see to it the Guard hangs you from the cliffs.
Ha!  As if they will believe you when I have witnesses here!
B-but... you wouldn't... that...
Very well.  I will see to it the arrows are delivered to the Palisade.  At once.
Don't twist the issue!  Targos has been bleeding me dry for the past month, and I've been forced to take loss after loss-
Hmmm.  Well... perhaps.   How many arrows do you need sent to the Palisade?
Fifteen *score?*  How many is that?
Hmph!  Then it'll cost you fifty gold, half for the arrows, half for the labor, *all* of it in advance.
Why, how much do you have?
Fine.  I'll have the arrows to the Palisade in a short while.  A... pleasure doing business with you.
Got that gold yet?  Fifty coins, and your friends at the Palisade can build a fence of arrows.
Targos is doomed as it is, goblins or no!  Don't martyr Targos in my store - don't you *dare,* not after all the bleeding they've done to me!
What do *you* want?  Next time, you ought to just come out and take what you want, rather than negotiate in Targos' name.
Ah, you're back!  I heard about your actions on the Palisade - without you, Targos could have fallen.  Please, let me know if I can help you with anything.
Ah, you're back!  I heard you were off exploring Shaengarne Ford.  Do you need any supplies?

I heard that fool Ulbrec sent you on a suicide mission to the goblin fortress.  It's interesting that he is a warrior of some reknown, and his wife is an enchantress, yet he sits in the Town Hall as comfortable as you please.  Hmmph.
I wouldn't be surprised.  I wonder if he ever gives his *wife* any impossible missions.
Congratulations!  I heard you killed the goblin *leader* in his own fortress!  That must have been a battle to see!
Good to see you back.  Anything you need?
Actually, we have come with a requisition for more arrows at the Palisade.
There's a goblin attack taking place on the docks - we are looking for Targos soldiers to aid us.
What is this place?
Actually, I've come to purchase supplies.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Yes, but we're looking for the Lord of Targos so we can warn the town.
We are, and we spoke to Lord Ulbrec, but we're looking for more reinforcements.
Do you know where we can find Ulbrec?
We'll head to the docks now, then.  Farewell.
We'll head to the docks now, then.  Farewell.
We'll head there now, then.  Farewell.
We're still hunting down the rest of them.  We just wanted to make sure you were all right.  Farewell.
No, we've driven them off - the docks should be safe.
What is this place?
I've come to purchase supplies.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Actually, we have come with a requisition for more arrows at the Palisade.
What is this place?
What is this place again?
I've come to purchase supplies.
Can I see what you have in stock?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
If this is the Depot, we have come with a requisition for more arrows at the Palisade.
Gallaway?  I've heard that name around Luskan and Bremen.
I've come to purchase any supplies you have left, then.
Can I see what you have left in stock?
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Very well.
Perhaps another time... farewell.
I've come to purchase supplies.
Can I see what you have in stock?
Nothing today.  Farewell.
If the Lord of Targos learns that his soldiers cannot obtain needed arms and armor at your store, I imagine he will not take the news kindly.
I understand your position, but without more arrows, Targos may fall to the next wave of goblin attackers.
And how dare *you* put your business before the welfare of Targos?  Is this what you want your coster known for - the fall of Targos?  Oh, you'll be *sure* to get plenty of business, then.
If you don't make preparations to send those arrows to the Palisade, I'll do more than play buccaneer in your store.
I understand your situation.  Perhaps Targos could pay you for these arrows.
Look, Targos may not be able to pay you, but perhaps we could pay you with our own coin.  Would that be agreeable?
How dare *you* put your business before the welfare of Targos?  Is this what you want your coster known for - the fall of Targos?  Oh, you'll be *sure* to get plenty of business, then.
If you don't make preparations to send those arrows to the Palisade, I'll tear down this store and take what I need.
Once I tell the Guard that I was merely attempting to deliver much-needed weapons to the Palisade, I think you'll find your case very difficult.
How dare *you* put your business before the welfare of Targos?  Is this what you want your coster known for - the fall of Targos?  Oh, you'll be *sure* to get plenty of business, then.
I understand your situation.  Perhaps Targos could pay you for these arrows.
Are you truly such a fool?  It is not a matter of witnesses, but *need* - Targos will be happy to take any excuse to liberate the Gallaway warehouse of its supplies.
How dare *you* put your business before the welfare of Targos?  Is this what you want your coster known for - the fall of Targos?  Oh, you'll be *sure* to get plenty of business, then.
I understand your situation.  Perhaps Targos could pay you for these arrows.

I don't wish to make a scene.  Please - have the arrows sent to the Palisade, and I will tell the Commander that you were extremely helpful.  I'm certain he will recompense you... when the conflict is over.
Good. I've come to purchase supplies for myself as well.
Before I depart, may I see what else you have in stock?
Farewell, Deirdre.  A pleasure doing business with you.

You will lose more if the goblins take the town - you may lose your life along with the townsfolk.  Either stand with them, earn their trust and respect, or you hold out on them, and earn their anger when this conflict is over.  Your choice.
If you don't make preparations to send those arrows to the Palisade, I'll tear down this store and take what I need.
I understand your situation.  Perhaps Targos could pay you for these arrows.
Fifteen score.
It's three hundred, of course.  Don't you know anything?
Three hundred arrows.
Fifty gold?  That's nothing... and here I was thinking you were going to bleed me dry.
Hmm.  I don't have that much - I will return when I do.
Actually, maybe I better sell some things to you first to raise the gold I need.
Actually, maybe I better sell some things to you first to raise the gold I need.
Don't play that game with me.  Here's your fifty gold.
Just fifty gold.  Here you are.
Actually, I've come to purchase supplies for myself as well.
Before I go, can I see what you have in stock?
A... pleasure as well.  Farewell.
Getting fifty gold together wasn't a problem at all - here I was thinking you were going to bleed me dry.
Hmm.  I don't have that much - I will return when I do.
Actually, maybe I better sell some things to you first to raise the gold I need.
Actually, maybe I better sell some things to you first to raise the gold I need.
And how dare *you* put your business before the welfare of Targos?  Is this what you want your coster known for - the fall of Targos?  Oh, you'll be *sure* to get plenty of business, then.
If you don't make preparations to send those arrows to the Palisade, I'll do more than play buccaneer in your store.
I understand your situation.  Perhaps Targos could pay you for these arrows.
Enough of your griping - let me see what you have in stock.
Consider yourself lucky we didn't.  Now farewell.
What is this place?
What is this place again?
I've come to purchase supplies.
Can I see what you have in stock?
Nothing today.  Farewell.
What is this place?
What is this place again?
Yes, I've come to purchase supplies.
Yes.  Can I see what you have in stock?
Not at this time.  Farewell.
I'm sure he has his reasons.  What is this place?
I'm sure he has his reasons.  What is this place again?
It's best he's out of harm's way.  In any event, I've come to purchase supplies.
It's best he's out of harm's way.  In any event, can I see what you have in stock?
Tell me about it.  I suspect the next mission he sends me on will take me to the Abyss with only a loincloth and a dagger.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Not likely.  What is this place?
Not likely.  What is this place again?
I doubt it.  In any event, I've come to purchase supplies.
I doubt it.  In any event, can I see what you have in stock?
I'm not touching *that* comment with a ten foot pole.  Farewell, Deirdre.
Only time will tell.  Farewell.
Well, we might not have been here if that half-dragon woman had stuck around.  What is this place?
Well, we might not have been here if that half-dragon woman had stuck around.  What is this place again?
I've come to purchase supplies.
It was, and it's why I could use some more supplies.
Just wait.  I imagine the next battle will involve me fighting white dragons with my teeth, if Ulbrec has any say in the matter.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
What is this place?
What is this place again?
I've come to purchase supplies.
I could use some more supplies.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
